events.title: Sunday Swap Meet and Brunch at the NSJ Community Center
events.description: The North San Juan Community Center is hosting a Sunday Swap Meet & Brunch. The swap meet will run from 9:00 am to 5:00 pm. Brunch service featuring the delectable delights of Chef John Finnegan will be served from 11:00 am to 2:00 pm. The menu will be posted weekly on the community center’s Facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/NSJCenter) and also on our website calendar (https://www.nsjcommunitycenter.org). A 10′ x 10′ booth space at the swap meet costs $20. Vendors must bring their own shad
events.venue_address: North San Juan Community Center, 29190 State Hwy 49, North San Juan, CA, 95960, United States

events.title: "One River, Many Visions" Exhibit at the Seven Stars Gallery
events.venue_name: Nevada City Odd Fellows Seven Stars Gallery
events.description: Nine local artists celebrate our “back yard” part of the great atmospheric and oceanic river that flows around the globe. Exhibiting artists are: Gail Lipson, Denise Wey, Jeff Bousfield, Beth Leydon, Chic Lotz, Steve Curl, Miriam Morris, Risa Roseman, Juliette Williams, Inge Ivens, and Leah Ellis The artists reception is from 5:00 – 7:00 pm on Friday, February 13th. Regular gallery hours are: Thursdays – Sundays, from 11:00 am to 5:00 pm For questions or to contact the gallery, please click here
events.venue_address: Nevada City Odd Fellows Seven Stars Gallery, 210 Spring St., Nevada City, 95959

events.title: 12th Annual Nevada City Chinese Lunar New Year Parade and Festival
events.description: CATS, along with the Miners Foundry Cultural Center, is proud to present this twelfth annual family-friendly celebration, honoring the early Chinese Gold Rush pioneers and railroad workers of the Sierra. Nevada County was once home to thousands of Chinese during the Gold Rush, and this event honors their legacy. The community parade begins at noon from the bottom of the Chinese Quarter on Commercial and Union Streets (Robinson Plaza) in Nevada City, where revelers may line up. After the Lion Dan
events.venue_address: Robinson Plaza, 132 Union Street, Nevada City, CA, 95959, United States

events.title: Gardens of Huemanity at Axis Gallery
events.description: Gardens of Huemanity by Delgreta Brown is an exploration of multiple environments — terrestrial, aquatic, celestial, and aerial. In a time where communities are challenged by the notion of belonging to society or lands, Delgreta Brown asserts that these vibrant, beautiful environments are enriched by an array of hues and inhabited by the African diaspora’s presence. Gardens of Huemanity is a visual and sensory effort to activate resilience. Delgreta depicts the African diaspora in these natural
events.venue_address: Axis Gallery, 625 S Street, Sacramento, CA, 95811, United States

events.title: Porcelain Ashtray at Axis Gallery
events.description: Friday, February 6th through Sunday, March 1st with regular gallery hours from noon t0 5:00 pm, Friday – Sunday. Second Saturday Reception from 5:00 – 8:00 pm on February 14th. Axis Gallery is pleased to present Porcelain Ashtray, an exhibition of new works by Sacramento-based artist Adam Cochran. Family slides taken in the 1950s, 60’s, and 70’s have been reworked and re-imagined as oil paintings, creating intimate moments of reflection and connection. With these paintings, Cochran has grappled
events.venue_address: Axis Gallery, 625 S Street, Sacramento, CA, 95811, United States

events.title: Music in the Mountains Presents Ray Ushikubo: Piano and Violin Virtuoso
events.description: Please join Music in the Mountains as they present virtuoso Ray Ushikubo at the Center for the Arts in downtown Grass Valley from 2:00 – 5:00 pm on Sunday, March 1st. Ray will showcase his stunning and award-winning musicianship on both piano and violin. He will play the MIM Steinway Grand, as well as one of the rarest and most famous violins in the world, the 1741 “Playfair” Guarneri del Gesù violin. At the age of only 24, he has already performed as soloist with major orchestras across the Uni
events.venue_address: The Center for the Arts, 314 W. Main Street, Grass Valley, CA, 95945, United States

events.title: Ukulele Singalong and Acoustic Jam at Wild Eye Pub
events.description: Yes, it’s another Ukulele Singalong and Jam! We had so much fun with it a few weeks ago, so we’re doing it again – from 2:00 to 4:30 pm on Sunday, March 1st (with doors opening at 1:30)! Calling all ukulele players, wannabes, and friends for an afternoon of singing, playing, and just plain fun. Uke and acoustic instrument players, singers, and music fans of all ages are welcome. Music/words will be projected up on the big screen. The pub offers a full menu (with table service) of food and drinks
events.venue_address: Wild Eye Pub, 535 Mill St, Grass Valley, CA, 95945, United States

events.title: Three Times Through at Grass Valley Brewing Company
events.description: Live at the Grass Valley Brewing Company, the first Sunday of every month. People ask us, “What is that instrument? And did you just mash-up a Rolling Stones song with an Irish jig?” Playing unique instruments, we are a kinda Celtic quartet re-imagining and blending traditional tunes with modern music. Come curious, leave refreshed!
events.venue_address: Grass Valley Brewing Company, 141 East Main Street, Grass Valley, CA, 95945, United States

events.title: Willy Tea Taylor and The Sam Chase at the Crazy Horse
events.description: Dynamic pairing alert! Prepare for a cosmic convergence of two of the finest blues/soul/folk singer/songwriters to grace the Crazy Horse stage. This will be a Sunday night never to forget! “Willy Tea Taylor’s music is about healing. It’s about refusing to pass judgment, and willing to give forgiveness and understanding to all. It’s medicine as music.” – Saving Country Music “We can positively certify, that Willy Tea Taylor is a bonafide national treasure.” – Glide Magazine “Taylor is not just a
events.venue_address: Crazy Horse Saloon, 230 Commercial Street, Nevada City, CA, 95959, United States

events.title: Yin Yoga: Four-Week Class Series at Sierra College Community Education
events.description: Please join us for the Yin Yoga Series at Sierra College Nevada County Campus, Community Education which meets from 5:30 – 6:30 pm on Monday evenings, March 2nd through 30th, 2026 (there will be no class on March 23rd) . Yin is a restorative style of yoga that works deep into the connective tissue for stretching and lengthening. Yin yoga poses are done on the floor and held for longer periods of time for the meditative benefits. This class helps activate the parasympathetic nervous system, the r
events.venue_address: Sierra College Community Education, 250 Sierra College Dr., Grass Valley, CA, 95945, United States

events.title: Weekly Vinyl Night: Nancie's Records at The Hillmont in Auburn
events.description: Vinyl night at The Hillmont from 6:00 – 10:00 pm each Monday night at 875 Lincoln Way in downtown Auburn! Featuring a rotating custom stereo each week – please bring your own records!
events.venue_address: The Hillmont, 875 Lincoln Way, Auburn, CA, 95603, United States

events.title: Music Mondays with Beaucoup Chapeaux at the National Exchange Hotel
events.description: World-fusion acoustic quartet Beaucoup Chapeaux plays at the National Exchange Hotel from 6:00 – 8:00 pm on Monday, March 2nd, presenting their richly eclectic repertoire, ranging from European and Balkan folk to Hot Club Jazz to American Folk/Pop and Originals. For the past two years, Beaucoup Chapeaux has enjoyed playing every three weeks at the National Exchange Hotel’s local music night, “Music Mondays.” So while you enjoy the Nash Bar’s excellent food and beverages in their enchanting, cand
events.venue_address: National Exchange Hotel, 211 Broad Street, Nevada City, CA, 95959, United States

events.title: Adult Purim Celebration at the NCJCC
events.description: IT’S PURIM TIME! Please join Rabbi David for pizza and Megillah from 6:30 – 8:00 pm on Monday, March 2nd at the Nevada County Jewish Community Center in Grass Valley. We’ll laugh, we’ll cry, we’ll learn, we’ll tell some jokes, sing some songs, and remember how we’ve made it through all these years. Adults only please. Kindly RSVP ahead of time, so we can plan for enough food, by calling (530) 477-0922, emailing ncjcc@outlook.com, or visiting our Facebook page here: https://www.facebook.com/event
events.venue_address: Nevada County Jewish Community Center, 506 Walsh St., Grass Valley, CA, 94945, United States

events.title: Love and Logic: "Magic for Early Childhood" Eight-Week Parenting Course
events.venue_name: Child Development Center at Sierra College Campus
events.description: This supportive class provides practical, effective strategies for raising young children with love, patience, and consistency. Discover proven solutions that help little ones to thrive while reducing stress for parents. For 48 years, Love and Logic has guided parents with simple, actionable tools to help manage early childhood challenges while building strong, loving relationships. Topics include: – Setting and keeping loving limits – Teaching young kids to listen the first time – Managing pott
events.venue_address: Child Development Center at Sierra College Campus, 250 Sierra College Drive, Grass Valley, 95945

events.title: Truckee Trivia Tuesdays at Alibi Ale Works
events.description: Truckee trivia Tuesdays! It just rolls right off the tongue, doesn’t it? Please come join our host, Craig, for a night full of brain busters and beer from 6:00 – 8:00 pm. Craig (the longest-standing trivia host in Truckee) creates all of the questions from scratch! So grab some friends and head over to Alibi Truckee for a chance to win a $50 Alibi gift card at our weekly Truckee Trivia.
events.venue_address: Alibi Ale Works – Truckee, 10069 Bridge Street, Truckee, CA, 96161, United States

events.title: Mountain Stream Meditation: "Sitting and Sangha" Weekly Meeting
events.description: Sitting and Sangha is a weekly in-person only meeting for group practice and discussion of dharma topics from 6:30 – 8:00 pm weekly on Tuesdays at Mountain Stream Meditation in Nevada City. Meetings are facilitated by senior dharma practitioners and community leaders. The group is inspired by the framework of a Kalyana Mitta (spiritual friendship) group, and the intention is to create a supportive and friendly environment for sharing and spiritual connection. The emphasis on the third jewel (San
events.venue_address: Mountain Stream Meditation, 710 Zion Stret, Nevada City, CA, 95959, United States

events.title: "The Rocket Man": Elton John Tribute at the Center for the Arts
events.description: Attention Elton John fans! Moon Coin Productions from Vancouver (producers of ABBA tribute ABRA Cadabra and Eagles tribute Take It To the Limit) presents The Rocket Man – a tribute to Elton John, performing in Grass Valley for the first time on March 3rd, 2026. Don’t miss this unusually and musically captivating stage production led by accomplished vocalist, pianist and star performer Sean Trombley, who gives a genuine and powerful tribute to the music that inspired him as a vocalist and musicia
events.venue_address: The Center for the Arts, 314 W. Main Street, Grass Valley, CA, 95945, United States

events.title: Special Nevada County Helpers Open-Mic Potluck, Theme: "Matriarchs and Elders"
events.description: The Nevada County Helpers Open-Mic Potluck is on from 3:00 – 8:00 pm on Wednesday, March 4th at the Seaman’s Lodge in Nevada City. The theme is “Matriarchs and Elders” – please bring a dish that’s part of your family’s traditions. Sign-up for the 0pen-mic starts at 3:00 pm, with performances taking place from 4:00 – 7:00 pm. The emcee is Chris French, and this event is hosted by members of United Domestic Workers. We’ll be collecting clothing and ability aids for our disabled neighbors. There wi
events.venue_address: Seaman’s Lodge, 427 Nimrod, Nevada City, 95959

events.title: Bluegrass Jam Night at Uncle Sonny's Bar
events.description: Bluegrass open jam session every Wednesday from 6:00 – 8:00 pm. All pickers and singers welcome for pickin’, toe-tappin’ fun at Uncle Sonny’s Bar: 13475 Colfax Highway/174 Grass Valley, CA 95945
events.venue_address: Uncle Sonny’s Bar, 13475 Colfax Hwy, Grass Valley, CA, 95945, United States

events.title: Rodney Crowell Brings his Airline Highway Tour to the Center for the Arts
events.description: Rodney Crowell is the songwriter’s songwriter — a Grammy-winning Texan troubadour whose songs have been sung by legends from Johnny Cash to Emmylou Harris. Over four decades, Crowell has crafted a remarkable catalog of hits while helping define the Americana sound, blending literary storytelling with timeless melodies. From his early days alongside Townes Van Zandt and Guy Clark to collaborations with Willie Nelson, Steve Earle, and Rosanne Cash, Crowell’s music captures the heart of American ro
events.venue_address: The Center for the Arts, 314 W. Main Street, Grass Valley, CA, 95945, United States

events.venue_name: Nevada City Odd Fellows Seven Stars Gallery

events.title: Sound Healing Meditation
events.description: Reset an recharge with the gentle sounds of Crystal Singing Bowls. Vibrational healing is deeply relaxing and therapeutic. Chairs, cushions and blankets available for your comfort or bring your own. We will be in stillness and silence for an hour. For more information, please click here: https://www.mtstream.org/nc-daily-schedule/2024/11/7-sound-healing

events.title: Mountain Stream Meditation: "Open Temple Fridays"
events.description: Each Friday, Mountain Stream Meditation in Nevada City opens the doors from 11:30 am to 1:00 pm for Open Temple Fridays as follows: – The center is open from 11:30 am – 1:15 pm. – Silent meditation is from 12:30 – 1:00 pm. This is a chance to enjoy Sangha and tea, recharge with a new (or old) book from our library, and practice together. On occasion, teachers may offer pop-up Dharma discussions as well. Thank you for all the ways you participate and for your generosity! We are also calling for v

events.title: "The Winters Where Catfish Sings": Exhibition by Sokthea Chan at Axis Gallery
events.description: The Winters Where Catfish Sings is a solo exhibition by Sokthea Chan that introduces a body of work inspired by the natural world, mythological stories, and poetry – from Friday, March 6th through Sunday, March 29th. The second Saturday reception will be from 5:00 – 8:00 pm on March 14th. The title of the exhibition draws its inspiration from cultural folklore that gives slight humor and sorrow to let the viewers to wonder and question its silly, bizarre name in relation to the work. events.venue_address: Axis Gallery, 625 S Street, Sacramento, CA, 95811, United States

events.title: Nevada County Jewish Community Center Family Shabbat
events.description: Please join us at the Nevada County Jewish Community Center (NCJCC) for our monthly family Shabbat dinner and service from 5:30 to 7:30 pm on Friday, March 6th!
